    • Method Detail

      • calculateSignal

        public abstract void calculateSignal(NeuralNet net,
                                     java.util.List<java.lang.Double> target,
                                     double minError)
        calculates the error values for the network. This is intended to be called after innervating the network. It should calculate the training signal for the output neurons (or for what the training algorithm wants),
        Parameters:
        net - the neural network that has been innervated.
        target - the desired network target output. May be null, if this is e.g. unsupervised learning.
        minError - smallest error that isn't considered as zero. If this parameter isn't needed, it should be ignored.
